faq.heading: Frequently asked questions
faq.intro: Simple answers to help you decide if Sarawak is a fit, and what the next steps look like.

safety.title: Safety and stability
safety.text: Sarawak is socially stable and largely free from major natural disasters like earthquakes, hurricanes, or tornadoes, making it a strong long term base for families and retirees.

families.title: Schooling and stability
families.summary: Most family decisions come down to education, routine, and long term stability. These are the questions we get most often.

items.q: Is Kuching suitable for raising children long term
items.a: Yes. Kuching is generally calm, multicultural, and family friendly. Many families prioritise safety, routine, and a stable day to day lifestyle.

items.q: Are there international schools and English based options
items.a: Yes. Kuching has multiple international schooling options and English based curricula are available, depending on the school and programme.

items.q: How much do international schools usually cost
items.a: As a rough range, international school fees can be around RM25,000 to RM45,000 per year depending on grade and programme.

items.q: Do we need to buy property to live here
items.a: No. For many plans, renting is a valid path. Property purchase is not compulsory for long term living decisions.

retirees.title: Comfort and healthcare
retirees.summary: Retirees usually care about healthcare access, cost control, and daily comfort without stress.

items.a: Kuching has a mix of public and private hospitals and clinics. Many retirees find the quality strong relative to cost.

items.q: Can retirement funds go further in Sarawak
items.a: Often yes. Lower daily living costs can allow a comfortable lifestyle while still maintaining quality and convenience.

items.q: Is Kuching a fast paced city
items.a: Not usually. Kuching is known for a calmer pace and is often preferred by those seeking slower living.

items.q: Do I need to worry about long term medical expenses
items.a: Costs vary by individual needs, but many people find healthcare more affordable than major global cities. Planning and insurance choices still matter.

programme.title: S MM2H clarity
programme.summary: This is the practical side: eligibility, process, timelines, and what support looks like.

items.q: What is S MM2H in simple terms
items.a: It is a long term residency pathway under Sarawak with specific requirements. It is often used by families and retirees planning a second home or long term base.
We provide independent guidance and planning support. Formal applications are typically handled by government recognised licensed partners.

items.q: How do I know if I should even apply
items.a: Start with fit first: lifestyle goals, budget, healthcare needs, and schooling plans. Then we work backwards into requirements and next steps.

items.q: What should I prepare before speaking to a partner
items.a: A clear plan: your target timeline, budget, preferred living area, whether you are renting or buying, and any schooling or healthcare priorities.
